item.title: What programming language do Dynamics GP Developers use?
item.description: This blog post is geared towards “GP Developers”. The author has been working with Visual Basic since the mid-1990s and transitioned to VB.NET in 2007. While the author has experience in C++ and C#, they primarily used VB.NET for its ease of transition. However, after learning about Object-Oriented (OO) application architecture in .NET, the author sees advantages in using C# for OO programming. Specifically, the author highlights that VB.NET’s method of handling Class Constructors, while convenient, can be less intuitive than the C# approach.
